questions.question: A person was found dead in the bushes with his hands tied. On examination of the body, there was cyanosis petechial hemorrhages, abrasions, and bruises around the mouth and lips.There was associated facial congestion and edema. What is the least likely cause of death here?
questions.explanation: Correct Answer: B) Suicide Explanation: Suicide is least likely because hands tied (self-restraining difficult) and facial trauma unusual in suicidal deaths. Key Findings: Hands tied â†’ Suggests restraint, highly indicative of homicide. Cyanosis and petechial hemorrhages: Signs of asphyxia. Abrasions and bruises around the mouth and lips : Consistent with smothering (external airway obstruction). Facial congestion and edema: Due to venous obstruction from asphyxia . Differentiation of Causes: Asphyxia (general term): Present, evidenced by petechiae, cyanosis, and facial congestion. Smothering (a form of asphyxia): Hands tied, mouth injuries indicate external airway obstruction. Homicide: Most consistent due to the tied hands and physical trauma. Reference: Deaths
